item.title: Oblivion Remastered: 8 Best Items To Sell, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Animal pelts are a simple yet valuable item to sell for easy money in Oblivion Remastered.
  • Collecting Welkynd Stones from Ayleid Ruins and alchemy equipment from Mage's Guild yields profit.
  • Crafting potions and poisons with cheap ingredients is the most lucrative way to make money in the game.

Oblivion Remastered caught many players by surprise when it released unexpectedly in April. With some players falling back into their roots of how they played the original, some new players that have never experienced The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion may be curious about the quick ways to make money in the hopes of purchasing arrows, stronger potions, and enchanted armor from merchants.

One of the easiest ways to make money in Oblivion Remastered is by selling everything the player finds to merchants. Since Oblivion Remastered has an encumbrance mechanic, a player will need to be careful about what they pick up if they hope to pull a profit from the merchants they sell to.

8 Animal Pelts

A Simple Pelt Sells For A Lot

One of the simplest things players can earn that can then be sold to make an easy bit of money is animal pelts. Players will likely encounter wolves, deer, bears, etc., while they explore the world of Cyrodiil in Oblivion Remastered . Each of these animals is guaranteed to drop their pelt once defeated, making it a promising way for a player to make money.

The weight of these pelts is next to nothing compared to the price of selling them. Therefore, a player should be certain to leave space for the animals they attack during their adventures, as these pelts can be sold to any general store, which the majority of towns in Oblivion Remastered have.

7 Welkynd Stones

Ayleid Ruins Are Filled With Them

While exploring the world of Oblivion Remastered , players are certain to encounter an abundance of Ayleid Ruins that litter the wilderness of Cyrodiil. Players who have plenty of free time and aren't focusing on the main story of this RPG should be sure to enter every ruin they find for an easy way to make money.

While exploring these ruins, players will find blue rocks that look similar to soul gems. These are called Welkynd Stones. Although they may be useful to a mage due to them replenishing all the player's magicka, they are even better at being sold. Each gem only weighs one, meaning a player can easily fill their inventory with every gem they see without worrying about them taking too much space.

6 Alchemy Equipment

Raid The Mage's Guilds For Easy Money

Alchemy Equipment is another guaranteed way for players to make easy money. Depending on the quality of the equipment, some of these utensils can sell for a lot more, while still weighing similarly.

Players who are wondering where in Oblivion Remastered they can find a lot of alchemy equipment to sell should look no further than the Mage's Guild. Once the player has applied to join the Mage's Guild, it is no longer classed as stealing to take the majority of the valuables found within each of the Mage's Guilds across Cyrodiil. Therefore, players can take all the alchemy equipment in these locations and sell it for an easy profit.

5 Spell Scrolls

Weigh A Little While Selling For A Lot

Another thing that can be commonly found in the Mage's Guild, as well as in the various chests players are likely to access during their adventures, are spell scrolls. While these scrolls are perfect for keeping in case of certain combat moments, the light weight of these scrolls also makes them a perfect item for the player to collect so that they can sell them once they arrive in town once more.

The selling cost of these scrolls can vary drastically for Oblivion Remastered , depending on the type of spell scroll the player is trying to sell. Therefore, a player should make sure they pick up every scroll, even if they don't think they'd use it.

4 Alchemical Ingredients

Players Can Carry Plenty To Sell

Another item players should be sure to sell is alchemical ingredients. There is an assortment of alchemical ingredients a player is likely to find during their adventures in this RPG that each has its own unique purpose, so that a player can make an abundance of potions.

Various ingredients in Oblivion have different rarities, which make some of them a lot more valuable than others. Besides rarity, flowers grow almost everywhere, meaning players can also find cheap ingredients, which can also be sold in abundance for an easy amount of money.

3 Weapons And Armor

It's Even Better If Enchanted

Unsurprisingly, one of the best items to sell is weapons and armor. Every humanoid foe a player faces will likely drop a weapon and the armor they are wearing. As players level, the armor and weapons these enemies are using will become stronger, which then also sell for a decent amount of coins.

While regular weapons may sell for a decent amount, especially if they are Daedric or Ebony, players can guarantee even more of a profit for themselves if the items they are selling are enchanted. It is, however, important to make sure the merchant these items are being sold to can afford to buy them.

2 Jewelry

Valuable Gems Are Found Within

Although it can be quite rare to find, jewelry is another great item to sell in Oblivion Remastered . These light but valuable rings come in all sorts of materials that determine the value for which they will sell.

Unlike other games in the franchise, such as Morrowind and Skyrim, the type of material the jewelry is made out of does not also determine the strength of the enchantment, and, therefore, players can easily sell the most valuable rings and necklaces they find without feeling like they need to keep them for enchantments. However, like armor and weapons, these enchanted rings will sell for more.

1 Potions And Poisons

Players Can Make Their Own Potions To Sell

Out of all the items that can be sold in Oblivion Remastered , by far the best and easiest for players to sell if they are hoping to make a lot of money are the variety of potions and poisons. While players can find plenty of potions to sell, some of the easiest money to be made in the game is by the player selling their creations.

By combining cheap ingredients, the player can make plenty of flasks to sell to merchants. A player may wish to take this a step further by maxing out their alchemy skill so that they can make a single-ingredient potion or poison, which allows them to make their ingredients go this step further for even more money.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: Easiest Skills To Level
item.description:
Summary

  • Alchemy and Security are easy skills to level due to simple gameplay mechanics.
  • Destruction magic school levels quickly with cheap spells created at the Arcane University.
  • Sneak skill is easily leveled by following NPCs, while Athletics levels faster by swimming.

Oblivion Remastered is an RPG with multiple skills that the player can level through their adventure. While choosing seven major skills will level these skills faster than the others, there is still a way for the player to quickly level a lot of the skills in Oblivion to easily get them to Master rank.

At different levels of a skill, a player will receive a perk that will best benefit them. By leveling up these skills, a player will have a much easier time fighting foes as well as leveling up their entire character. Out of all the skills available in Oblivion Remastered , these are the easiest to level due to how quickly they can go up while the player adventures.

8 Light/Heavy Armor

Every Hit Of Damage Levels Armor

Although Light Armor and Heavy Armor are two separate skills, both can be easily leveled in the same way. Unless the player is taking on the role of a Mage that only wears robes, a player should always have a full suit of armor equipped in order to avoid the damage taken by the foes they face.

Players don't need to do anything special to level this easy skill in Oblivion Remastered, as every time the player is hit, they will likely be leveling the skill. Therefore, if someone wanted to level up their heavy or light armor quickly, they could put on a healing spell and allow a foe to attack them repeatedly until they had leveled up their skill.

7 Destruction

Making Cheap Spells Levels This Quickly

The majority of the schools of magic in Oblivion Remastered can be very easily increased once the player has unlocked access to the Arcane University, which can be accessed after gaining all the recommendations of the Mage's Guild. Players are able to create their own cheap spells within the university.

By repeatedly casting the spell created, the player will be able to quickly level up their school of choice. Players can do this without needing the Arcane University, though they must rely on finding a cheap spell to purchase, though players will also naturally level this skill if they use magic constantly in combat.

6 Alchemy

Create Cheap And Easy Potions

While a player may never use any of the poisons or potions they create in Oblivion Remastered , Alchemy is by far one of the easiest skills to level in this RPG, especially for those that are hoping to make money through selling these creations.

Players may expect that they need to create strong potions in the hopes of leveling this skill. However, in Oblivion Remastered , the strength of the potion doesn't determine the experience gained from it. Instead, players should focus on making as many potions as possible with common ingredients that they can get their hands on easily.

5 Security

Players Can Easily Exploit This Skill

Lock picking in Oblivion Remastered is another skill that players can very easily level to 100 in a few short moments, especially if a player is willing to exploit the system in the hopes of leveling it. In Oblivion , the Security skill levels every time a tumbler is locked into place.

Therefore, a player should find a door or chest that has multiple tumblers and lock one of them, then the player can repeatedly set the tumbler on the one that has been locked, which falsely tells the game that there has been a failed attempt. Each failed attempt gives the player experience until the player has made it to 100 Security.

4 Acrobatics

Players Should Be Jumping Everywhere

Acrobatics is one of several skills in Oblivion Remastered that is leveled when traversing the world of Cyrodiil. Acrobatics levels every time the player jumps, especially if the player jumps and takes falling damage.

Therefore, to quickly level this skill in Oblivion , a player should find a jumping spot where they can repeatedly jump between places, as this will increase the experience multiplier for acrobatics. Players that wish to speed up this process even further should make sure they have plenty of restore fatigue potions with them, as each jump does use some of the bar.

3 Mercantile

Players Should Always Be Selling Items

Mercantile is a skill in Oblivion that players will master alongside mastering Alchemy. The easiest way to level this skill in Oblivion Remastered is by selling to merchants. Players that are hoping to make a lot of money fast will likely be visiting merchants all the time to sell anything they have found that they no longer wish to carry.

When players are leveling Alchemy, as mentioned, they will be creating plenty of simple potions which may not sell for much. When leveling Mercantile, the cost of the sold goods does not matter, but the quantity does. Therefore, to level it up quickly, a player should be sure to sell each item individually.

2 Sneak

Follow NPCs Around To Level This Fast

Another simple skill that players can level easily in Oblivion Remastered is Sneak. Players increase their sneak value by stealth against unaware NPCs. Players can easily level this skill in Oblivion Remastered by employing the Stealth Walk method. This means a player should traverse everywhere in the game, especially in crowded areas, by sneaking.

To make the most of this method and therefore quickly level Sneak, a player should be sure to focus on following an NPC around while sneaking to level up from their oblivious nature. Players can also find an area where NPCs don't commonly move and then walk into a wall to easily level the skill.

1 Athletics

Swimming Levels It Faster Than Sprinting

The easiest skill for players to level in Oblivion Remastered is the Athletics skill. By leveling this skill, a player increases how fast their character walks, swims, and sprints. Not to mention that at certain levels of Athletics, the player also reduces the amount of fatigue they receive from sprinting in Oblivion Remastered .

Although this skill can be leveled naturally as the player explores in Oblivion , those who choose not to use Fast Travel will likely spend a lot of their time walking on-foot around Cyrodiil. However, a much quicker and easier way to level this skill is by swimming. Players have found that by swimming through the rivers of Oblivion constantly for a whole in-game night, they can quickly reach max level of Athletics.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Destiny 2: Hush God Rolls Guide
item.description:
Hush is one of the best legendary PvE combat bows players can get in Destiny 2 , and that's largely thanks to its perk pool. This weapon was amazing when it was first released, and since its return in Season 24, it only got better.

If you're looking for a solid add-clear weapon for taking on difficult content in Destiny 2 , then a Hush god roll should definitely be on your list of things to farm. Here are the best perk combos you can get for this bow, as well as some insight on what makes this weapon shine.

Best Perks For Hush in Destiny 2

Hush God Rolls in Destiny 2

PvE

  1. Elastic String
  2. Straight Fletching
  3. Archer's Tempo
  4. Incandescent/Archer's Gambit/Explosive Head
  5. Draw Time Masterwork

PvP

  1. Elastic String
  2. Straight Fletching
  3. Opening Shot/Hip-Fire Grip
  4. Archer's Gambit/Successful Warm-Up
  5. Draw Time Masterwork

PvE Roll

Hush's role in PvE varies greatly based on what its fourth column perk is. Incandescent turns it into an amazing AoE weapon with good synergy with Solar builds. Meanwhile, Explosive Head makes it a decent option for dealing with yellow-bar/Major enemies, as the arrow explosions can cause them to stagger.

Archer's Gambit is a sort of in-between of the two perks above. It significantly decreases the draw time of your bow after you land a hip-fire Precision hit, allowing you to take down multiple red-bar/Minor enemies in a row, or take out a single Major enemy more quickly than usual.

PvP Roll

As for PvP, any combination of the third and fourth column perks above can serve you well. Opening Shot and Hip-Fire Grip improve your aim consistency from a neutral state. Meanwhile, Archer's Gambit and Successful Warm-up can help you go on those long killstreaks by giving you faster draw times.

Keep these things in mind depending on what perks you get for your Hush:

  • Opening Shot provides a stronger bonus to aim assist and range than Hip-Fire Grip, but it goes on a 3-second cooldown after every activation.
  • Hip-Fire Grip is always active, so long as you fire from the hip. Combine this with Freehand Grip for even more hip-fire accuracy.
  • Archer's Gambit provides a stronger draw time reduction (60% vs 37.5%) than Successful Warm-Up, but it can only last for 8 seconds at most.
  • Successful Warm-Up has a base duration of 6 seconds (compared to 4 seconds for Archer's Gambit), and kills while the buff is active adds 4 more seconds to the buff's duration, up to a maximum of 20 seconds.

Where to Get Hush?

Hush is a Precision Frame bow that players can get from playing Gambit . You can get one by opening an Engram or by purchasing a random roll from the Drifter's Focused Decoding menu for 3 Gambit Engrams and a pile of Glimmer.

Why Choose Hush?

Bows with the perk combos listed above are rare, and if you're a fan of bows in Destiny 2 , you'll be glad to know that Hush feels incredibly snappy and satisfying to use. Its DPS and potential AoE damage are great for a Legendary weapon, and while it won't quite match Exotic bows in some areas, it's always nice to have a weapon that can do a bit of everything.

If you don't want to play Gambit, then the Non-Denouement bow from the Salvation's Edge raid comes very close in terms of performance. Pre-Astyanax IV is also a good alternative for PvE players, but it's only from Commander Zavala as a Legacy Nightfall weapon.

item.title: 8 Most Fun PS2 Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Okami is visually stunning with unique gameplay mechanics, an interactive world, and is packed with entertaining content.
  • Resident Evil 4 offers intense action, rewarding shooting mechanics, iconic enemies, and a relentless gameplay experience.
  • Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 excels with fast and fluid gameplay, endless replayability, and a fun, momentum-based movement system.

The best-selling console of all time and one of the best generations for video games, the PlayStation 2 era brought with it so many fan-favorite franchises and groundbreaking titles that revolutionized the gaming world and continue to have sequels and re-releases nearly two decades later. The impact of the console is simply immeasurable, and the titles available at the time speak for themselves.

At the heart of any game is pure fun. As much as a video game can focus on story or complex themes, sometimes it's nice to have a solid balance of story and entertaining gameplay, or to even go a step further and push the fun factor to the maximum to create the most enjoyment possible.

8 Okami

Painting The World Piece By Piece

Okami
8.3 /10
Released
September 19, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Developer(s)
Capcom, Clover Studio
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, PS2, Xbox One, Switch, Wii, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

For the art style alone, Okami is visually stunning, and the gameplay feeds into the art, using it as a main mechanic for all aspects of the game. A blending of Japanese mythology with Zelda -style exploration, players control Amaterasu, the sun goddess in wolf form, as she restores life and color to a cursed world. The game’s signature feature is the Celestial Brush mechanic, which lets players draw symbols on the screen that can be used in both combat and to manipulate the environment, offering a uniquely interactive experience.

What makes Okami so fun is the ability to interact with the world in interesting and clever ways. The painterly art mechanic brings the world to life with each stroke of the brush, making even the act of restoring a tree feel rewarding. It’s packed with dungeon content and side-quests to keep the player entertained for hours, all wrapped in a whimsical tone that feels straight out of a fairytale. Its originality and warmth make it one of the most memorable and enjoyable experiences on the PS2, and with a sequel on the way, hopefully, they can recapture even a smidgen of that same flair and fun.

7 Resident Evil 4

Survival Horror At Its Best

Resident Evil 4
7 /10
20
9.5 /10
Released
January 11, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10
20
9.5 /10

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, PS2, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Switch, Wii, Nintendo GameCube, PC, Android, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Arguably the best in the horror genre even today, Resident Evil 4 is a wild ride from start to finish. Leaning more into the action side and putting a heavy emphasis on gunplay, players investigate a barren land in search of the President's daughter, encountering more than a few zombie-like enemies and mutated creatures that need to be put to sleep.

The shooting feels rewarding, and every kill is paired with a healthy dose of gore and blood, adding a level of realism to every encounter and pushing the limits of the console. And with a whole cast of iconic characters and even more iconic enemies, the joy never ceases, and while normally the player might be running scared, in this case, the game encourages them to push forward head-on and to shoot their way through anything in their path.

6 Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3

So Much Style And So Much Freedom

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3
8.5 /10
Released
October 30, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Mild Lyrics, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Neversoft, Shaba Games, Vicarious Visions, HotGen
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), PlayStation 2, Xbox (Original), Nintendo GameCube, Nintendo 64, Nintendo Game Boy Color, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PC
Powered by

Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 perfected the series’ arcade-style skating formula, delivering fast and fluid gameplay across a variety of imaginative levels. Players have a lot of freedom to perform complex trick chains, discover hidden routes, and complete level-specific challenges using a tight control system that rewards both creativity and precision. With a few extra new mechanics like the revert move, combos, and high scores, suddenly had a new level of depth, and the amount of time players can spend perfecting a single chain is unlimited.

What makes the game especially fun is its near-endless replayability. Each level is filled with collectibles and hidden objectives that not only encourage exploration but experimentation and mastery. Combined with a killer soundtrack and the ability to play as a range of wild characters, the game never takes itself too seriously. It’s the kind of experience where five-minute sessions easily turn into hours, and its momentum-based movement still feels great over two decades later.

5 Rayman 2: Revolution

Pure Platforming Perfection

Rayman 2: Revolution
3D Platformer
Systems
Released
January 30, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Rayman 2: Revolution brought the lovable, limbless hero into a full 3D world full of vibrant colors and charm that continues to shine today. Fighting through robot pirates and rescuing captives, every moment is full of smiles throughout, and the addition of new and fun mechanics in almost every stage keeps it feeling fresh and engaging in an already crisp and well-polished platformer.

The blend of platforming with deep exploration invited players to go out in search of hidden areas and collectibles, and with such rewarding jumps and so much joy to see in the environment, even running around with no enemies can still be incredibly enjoyable. So much beauty and more than a few surprises, the quirky little fella continues to excite and deliver an unforgettable gaming experience several decades after he first graced the screens.

4 Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater

Stealth Never Felt So Good

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater (2004)
9.7 /10
Released
November 17, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes
Developer(s)
Konami
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2
Powered by

Few stealth games hold quite the same esteem as Metal Gear Solid 3 . A Cold War-era jungle full of iconic bosses and a whole range of threats, players are given a whole toolshed of systems to utilize, like camouflage and trap setting to make the environment feel like a canvas on which to engage with the map in new and interesting ways that the series hadn't seen before.

Experimentation is really at the heart of the gameplay, and players are able to sneak and approach any scenario however they choose, while still having to manage plenty of meters like stamina and injuries. It is an immersive stealth game unlike any other and pushes players to explore every aspect of the combat and approach enemies in ways they could only dream of before.

3 God Of War

Would Could Be Better Than Killing A God?

God of War (2005)
9.0 /10
Released
March 22, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Santa Monica Studio
Platform(s)
PS2
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The original God of War is one of those games that defies expectations when it comes to cinematic storytelling and combat brutality. With the mission dumbing down to basically killing the God of War himself, players are armed to the teeth with razor-sharp blades and a rage that could topple mountains. Slicing through hordes of enemies in seconds and the tight blending of hack-and-slash action with other mechanics like platforming, turns even the simplest moments into a true adventure.

There is a constant sense of momentum and forward motion, and every moment belongs on the big screen, with spectacular shots that truly take the player's breath away. It never feels like the game slows down, and even when there is a moment of pause from hacking away at the beasts, it isn't long before the action returns, setting a new standard for not only the genre but games on the system as a whole.

2 Devil May Cry

The Start Of The Demon Destroying Dynasty

Devil May Cry
8.5 /10
Released
October 16, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Capcom Production Studio 4
Platform(s)
PS2, PC, PS3, PS4, Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Style, speed, and pure sword-swinging goodness, Devil May Cry has long been a fan favorite in the world of action and for good reason. Combining medieval settings with fast-paced gunplay, it's the perfect mix of old and new, bringing so much fun even in the easiest of fights. The game lives and breathes excitement, rewarding and fluid fighting, and letting the player become a true demon-killing machine.

It brings a decent amount of challenge, combined with plenty of stylistic flair, that brings so much aggression and creativity at every step along the way. Over the top and dramatic don't even begin to describe it, and with a leading man who has so much arrogance and charisma, it is hard to look away from even the bloodiest moments.

1 Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

A True Open-World Playground

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
110
8.7 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3, Xbox (Original), Xbox 360, PC, macOS, iOS, Android
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas expanded the open-world formula to jaw-dropping proportions. Players step into the shoes of CJ, navigating a massive, fictional version of California full of gangs and corruption in a city brimming with content. The game mixes story-driven missions with free-roam chaos, allowing players to traverse the world however they choose.

What makes San Andreas so fun is its sheer variety. One minute, it's racing dirt bikes through the countryside; the next, skydiving into a casino heist. The possibilities are quite literally unlimited. It’s full of surprises, humor, and freedom, making it a sandbox that feels alive. With its rich narrative and jam-packed world, it’s a landmark title that still holds up today.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Hugo Build Guide
item.description:
Hugo Vlad is a powerful Ice Attack character in Zenless Zone Zero , designed to function as a standard DPS unit with notable daze output. His kit benefits significantly from a team setup featuring two stun agents , maximizing his buffs and control capabilities. While this requirement can limit team composition flexibility, for combat that benefits from enemies being stunned often, this is excellent, especially if players want to use generalized support units like Astra Yao in team compositions where she's needed much more.

In terms of build, luckily, Hugo does not demand heavy investment to perform optimally. Since there is no dedicated Drive Disc set for him, players can leverage existing, well-rounded options that enhance his strengths without requiring specialized gear. The same goes for his W-Engine options; outside of his signature, he can effectively use multiple other S-Rank and A-Rank options. Here’s the best way to optimize Hugo's build in Zenless Zone Zero .

Hugo Build In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

W-Engine

Drive Discs

Drive Discs Stat

  1. Myriad Eclipse
  2. Deep Sea Visitor
  3. Heartstring Nocturne
  4. Severed Innocence
  5. The Brimstone
  6. Marcato Desire
  7. Cannon Rotor
  8. Gilded Blossom
  9. Starlight Engine

4-piece set:

  • Woodpecker Electro
  • Hormone Punk

2-piece set:

  • Branch & Blade Song
  • Woodpecker Electro
  • Polar Metal

  • 4 slot: Crit DMG or Crit Rate (until 80-100%)
  • 5 slot: Ice DMG or ATK
  • 6 slot: ATK
  • Sub-stat priority: Crit Rate, Crit DMG, ATK, Pen

Hugo Best Drive Discs In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

To build Hugo Vlad effectively in Zenless Zone Zero , players need to prioritize maintaining an 80–100% Crit Rate to maximize his damage output. His core passive allows him to self-buff Crit Rate, Crit DMG, and ATK%, provided he has stun agents in the team to activate the ATK buff. This makes optimizing his stats more straightforward compared to other Crit-oriented DPS characters.

The best Drive Disc set for Hugo is 4pc Woodpecker Electro , as it boosts his Crit Rate while also enhancing his ATK every time he lands a Crit hit. Given Hugo's ability to frequently trigger Crits as long as he's kept on a high Crit Rate, maintaining the 4pc effect is relatively effortless. To further optimize his damage, pairing Woodpecker Electro with 2pc Branch and Blade Song is recommended to increase his Crit DMG.

For players who need an alternative, 4pc Hormone Punk serves as a strong placeholder, providing an ATK boost whenever Hugo is switched in . In this setup, 2pc Woodpecker Electro can be included to maintain additional Crit Rate while allowing room for a gradual transition into a full 4pc set.

Players looking to increase his elemental damage can opt for 2pc Polar Metal , which enhances Ice DMG, making it another strong consideration for Hugo’s build.

When optimizing Hugo's stats in Zenless Zone Zero , Crit Values and ATK should be the primary focus . If players equip Hugo with his signature W-Engine, or any other W-Engine that provides Crit Rate, the best approach is to use Crit DMG as the main stat on the 4th Drive Disc slot while acquiring the remaining Crit Rate through sub-stats. However, if achieving the desired Crit Rate threshold through sub-stats isn’t feasible, prioritizing Crit Rate over Crit DMG is essential to maintain consistent high-damage output.

For the 5th and 6th Drive Disc slots, ATK% is generally the best option, though Ice DMG can be a viable alternative for the 5th slot depending on which stat rolls better sub-stats. The difference in performance between ATK% and Ice DMG is minimal, especially since Hugo benefits from ATK buffs through other means. As for sub-stats, Crit Rate, Crit DMG, and ATK remain the top priorities. Flat ATK is preferable over PEN, but PEN can still provide value as a generic stat, making it a reasonable secondary choice.

Hugo Best W-Engines In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

When selecting Hugo’s W-Engine in Zenless Zone Zero, prioritizing Crit Rate and Crit DMG is crucial to maximizing his damage output. His signature Myriad Eclipse is the best choice, offering Crit Rate as its ascension stat, along with Crit DMG and DEF ignore whenever Hugo uses EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate. While the latter is situational, this effect ensures his strongest attacks land with higher damage, making it a highly effective option.

For alternatives, Deep Sea Visitor, which is Ellen’s signature W-Engine , is another viable choice. It provides the same Crit Rate ascension stat but boosts Ice DMG and grants additional Crit Rate through its effect. This allows players to shift their focus more toward Crit DMG and ATK when building Hugo, as achieving the required Crit Rate threshold becomes significantly easier. Another strong option is Heartstring Nocturne , Evelyn’s signature W-Engine . It shares similarities with Hugo’s own signature, providing Crit Rate ascension and Crit DMG, though its Fire RES secondary effect is useless for him. Because of this, Deep Sea Visitor remains a more fitting S-Rank alternative.

For players prioritizing Crit DMG, Severed Innocence can also be equipped, though the previously mentioned choices will generally perform better on Hugo. As a non-limited S-Rank option, The Brimstone stands out for players focusing on raw ATK%. While it does not provide Crit Rate or Crit DMG enhancements, its ATK% boost makes it a solid choice for increasing overall damage output, especially in setups where Crit Rate is already optimized.

Among non-limited and A-Rank options, Marcato Desire and Cannon Rotor are the best picks, as they offer Crit Rate ascension and ATK buffs—albeit at lower values than 5-star alternatives. Gilded Blossom and Starlight Engine are alternative A-Rank choices, but they focus only on ATK, similarly to the Brimstone, requiring players to fully optimize Hugo’s Crit Rate and Crit DMG through his Drive Discs to maintain effectiveness.
